section.name: Overview
section.p: The display tag library is an open source suite of custom tags that provide high level web presentation patterns which will work in an MVC model. The library provides a significant amount of functionality while still being simple and straight-forward to use.

subsection.name: January 3, 2004
subsection.p: Snapshot builds are now available. See download for details. Also check the nice statcvs reports, I finally managed to make this maven plugin working...

subsection.name: December 30, 2003
subsection.p: Started working on 1.0-b3 release. The site is always updated with the latest changes, so be sure to refer to the docs included in the distribution zip for previous releases. We will try to make nightly build available shortly.

subsection.name: December 8, 2003
subsection.p: 1.0-b2 is finally out! Check out changes for details about new features and fixed bugs and download the distribution here .

Note that the b2 version now requires j2ee 1.3 to compile, but it still runs on any j2ee 1.2 container. The new export filter (fixes exporting with includes or struts tiles) can only be used on 1.3 containers.

section.name: What can I do with it?
section.p: Actually the display tag library can just... display tables! Give it a list of objects and it will handle column display, sorting, paging, cropping, grouping, exporting, smart linking and decoration of the table in a nice and customizable xhtml style.
